source_sentence: **Tesaṁ paneke samayaṁ vadanti, anupādisese kusalāvadānā**ti tesaṁyeva samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ucchedavādā bhavatajjitā vibhavaṁ abhinandanti, te sattassa samaṁ upasamaṁ vūpasamaṁ nirodhaṁ paṭipassaddhinti vadanti, yato kiṁ, bho, ayaṁ attā kāyassa bhedā ucchijjati vinassati na hoti paraṁ maraṇā, ettāvatā anupādisesoti.
translation: Since they were exclusively profitable, they say: ‘This is the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being’ when their body breaks up, after death, they say that this self exists after death.’

source_sentence: **Kusalāvadānā**ti kusalavādā paṇḍitavādā thiravādā ñāyavādā hetuvādā lakkhaṇavādā kāraṇavādā ṭhānavādā sakāya laddhiyāti—
translation: Views of skillful deeds, doctrine, and views. Their efficacy of others is the same.

source_sentence: Muni sassatadiṭṭhinissitāti ñatvā, ucchedadiṭṭhinissitāti ñatvā, sassatucchedadiṭṭhinissitāti ñatvā jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.
translation: Knowing this, annihilationist views, annihilationist views, doubt, and uncertainty, and who understands the origin of the world, and who, having known their own views, and sustained it by themselves.

source_sentence: **So vimaṁsī**ti paṇḍito paññavā buddhimā ñāṇī vibhāvī medhāvīti ñatvā muni nissaye so vimaṁsī.
translation: He knows (these) wise manages what is wise, learned, a wise one, knowing his knowledge of the Three Wise One, a clever man, knowing his knowledge of (the range) his various knowledges.

source_sentence: **Ñatvā vimutto na vivādametī**ti ñatvā jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.

source_sentence: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti ñatvā jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā mutto vimutto parimutto suvimutto accantaanupādāvimokkhenāti—
translation: “Anything that has a beginning has an end,” he freed through the ending of all things. Then he freed through the destruction of the pollutants, freed through the ending of liberation, which, after having made it freed through the ending of liberation, he is freed through the ending of liberation.

source_sentence: **Na vivādametī**ti na kalahaṁ karoti, na bhaṇḍanaṁ karoti, na viggahaṁ karoti, na vivādaṁ karoti, na medhagaṁ karoti.
translation: he doesn’t make arguments, quarrels, or disputes in the midst of argument, nor separates it.
for this is said by the Buddha,

source_sentence: “evaṁ vimuttacitto kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu na kenaci saṁvadati, na kenaci vivadati, yañca loke vuttaṁ tena ca voharati aparāmasan”ti—
translation: “A mendicant whose mind is freed like this doesn’t side with anyone or fight with anyone. They speak the language of the world without misapprehending it.”

The wise one does not come together,

source_sentence: **Bhavābhavāyā**ti bhavāya kammabhavāya punabbhavāya kāmabhavāya, kammabhavāya kāmabhavāya punabbhavāya rūpabhavāya, kammabhavāya rūpabhavāya punabbhavāya arūpabhavāya, kammabhavāya arūpabhavāya punabbhavāya punappunabbhavāya punappunagatiyā punappunaupapattiyā punappunapaṭisandhiyā punappunaattabhāvāya punappunābhinibbattiyā na sameti na samāgacchati na gaṇhāti na parāmasati nābhinivisati.
translation: You don’t neglect future rebirth, old age, and death in the future. They don’t lead to future lives, hurtful, resulting in future rebirth, old age, and death. And don’t come back to future lives, or again in the future.

source_sentence: **Dhīro**ti dhīro paṇḍito paññavā buddhimā ñāṇī vibhāvī medhāvīti—
translation: The wise one is wise, learned, one who has understanding, one who is wise, possessed of (the nature of) knowledge, one who is wise,
The wise don’t agree with continued existence,
The Buddha replied,
“Knowing this, they give up.
Having understood (that), I did know.
Having understood the end of a dispute,
The wise don’t agree with continued existence.”
